neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics (Michael Rule’s conflicted copy 2017-08-11) module¶

Contains statistical routines. All routines assume float32 arrays as the underlying datatype.

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.ElementwiseKernel(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpu_histogram(data, min, max, bins)[source]¶
neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpubarlinedata(xdata, ydata, bins, minval=None, maxval=None)[source]¶
neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpubin(size)¶
neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpubin_core(data, size)[source]¶
neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpucenter(v)¶

Mean-centers a vector on the GPU

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpucorr(a, b)¶

Computes the correlation coefficient between two vectors

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpucov(a, b)¶

Computes the covariance of two vectors.

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpuhistogram(xdata, ydata, bins, minval=None, maxval=None)[source]¶
neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpumag(x)¶

Computes the magnitude of a vector

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpumean(v)¶

Computes the population mean of a float vector on the GPU

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpuscorr(a, b)¶

Computes the sample correlation of two vectors

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpuscov(a, b)¶

Computes the sample covariance of two vectors

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpusdv(a, b)¶

Computes elementwise squared deviation from a constant value. For example, gpusdev(data,c) will return the squared distance of all elements in data from c. This is a slightly better way of writing (data-c)**2 as it avoids an intermediate array creation and copy

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpusem(v)¶

Computes the standard error of mean for a vector

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpusqdev(v)¶

Computes the sum of squared deviation from mean for a vector

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpusqmag(v)¶

Computes the squared magnitude of a vector

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpusstd(x)¶

Computes the sample standard deviation of a vector

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpustd(x)¶

Computes the population standard deviation of a vector

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpusvar(v)¶

Computes the sample variance of a vector

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpuvar(v)¶

Computes the population variance of a vector

neurotools.gpu.cu.statistics.gpuzscore(v)¶

Computes the z-scores for a vector using sample statistics
